38572806.review:
At the time of writing, I'm playing a lot of games that are quite heavy on the game-mechanics side of things (HeXen, Unreal, Prince of Persia, STALKER) or story (KoTOR II, Mafia).

For me, this is the perfect cooldown from endless dialog trees, droves of enemy types and labyrinths upon labyrinths of levels. Just shoot the on-rails moving balls with your static frog turret so the ball colours match and clear the level before the time runs out. You have some fairly straightforward powerups like slow moving balls and reverse movement direction, then there's accuracy and explosion. Nothing too fancy, but it's so effective as a time killer.

The music is also very fitting, just hype enough to keep your brain firing but still inocuous enough to not make you nervous (unless you're near death, then the music changes and it's meant to make you nervous).

There's an "adventure" mode, where you complete levels by hitting a certain points threshold, and survival mode with four difficulty levels where the balls just keep coming until you lose.

Don't let this fool you into thinking the game is easy, however. It has that patented PopCap balance of challenging, addictive and still enjoyable. Like I said, I love to play it when I don't feel like watching a movie or series but I don't feel like playing some hardcore 90s FPS either.

The only downside is that the levels in this game are saved as 640x480 JPEG files, so there is absolutely no way to change the resolution, let alone aspect ratio. On my 1366x768 laptop screen, it's not as bad, but I imagine it would be pretty jarring on a 1080 or even 1440 screen.

All in all, it's a shame they didn't update the visuals or even just upscale the whole thing, otherwise this game would be perfect - it's a steal during sales anyway, so even with the dated visuals, I recommend it wholeheartedly.

37548289.review:
As one of the PopCap classics from the mid 2000s, Zuma brought me and my family counless fun hours for over a decade.
The gameplay is simple, match three balls of the same color together and get combos, chains or collect randomly appearing coins to increase the yielded score.
There's also a couple of power-ups which appear occasionally which can help you, such as reversing the balls movement, stopping their movement entirely, causing a big explosion which destroys its surrounding balls and an aim help which lets you shoot your balls quicker.

This game is brought down in two modes, the Adventure and a Gauntlet mode (which is pretty much a survival mode).
-The Adventure Mode is a stage-to-stage Level Rush where you have to score a specific amount of points to stop more balls from spawning and then clear the screen to get to the next stage.
All this is split into multiple different worlds with more colors to appear the deeper you get.
-The Gauntlet Mode allows you to play any stage you beat in the Adventure Mode and attempt to survive as long as you can, while attempting to score as much points as possible.

One thing I'd like to mention is the games modability, yes I'm serious!
If you look into the local files, you notice that most image and audio files (except of the background-music unfortunately) use default file extensions and formatting.
This means you can easily replace game files and inplement your own files if you want an entirely new Zuma experience!
I cannot tell you if any format works, but as long as you covert your files into the same extension as they were in Zuma (most of them are .jpg, .gif and .ogg), it should work just fine. (atleast it did for me and a friend of mine)
You might want to backup your save file though prior to the modding, just in case something goes majorly wrong which forces you to re-install the game, thus as always mod at your own risk!

The only problems I have are:
 -Maximum resolution of 640x480, which you can get used to in fullscreen, but can cause trouble when playing in windowed mode. (see next point)
-The game does not force the cursor inside the games window when you don't use fullscreen, hence you can click outside the window accidentaly and not shoot while playing. Trust me, this happens more than you'd wish!
-I honestly believe it's not worth the full price of €5 any more. This game came out 14 years ago and its successor is avaiable for the same price, offering way more.

BUT:
If this game IS on sale, I can only recommend this to anyone as it's a very addictive experience which first up seems very simple, but gets more complex when you get to later stages, both in Adventure and in Gauntlet.
The graphics are ok for its time while the music fits the atmosphere perfectly.
Even if my playtime on Steam isn't that high yet, I can promise you my (and also my parents) time spent into this game would exceed your expectations.

36235173.review:
[h1] "Você consegue dominar os segredos de Zuma?" [/h1]
Zuma é um [strike]político do ANC[/strike] grande clássico dos jogos de "quebra-cabeça" ou[i] puzzle[/i], onde você controla um sapo que atira "bolinhas coloridas" de sua boca com o objetivo de destruir linhas (de diferentes formas e curvas) também formadas por tais bolinhas, sendo que, para tal, é necessário unir no mínimo três dessas já citadas. Há também bolas com diferentes "habilidades" que te ajudam na aventura, como explodir, aumentar o foco, atrasar o tempo, etc.
Com uma grande diversidade de fases/templos para se passar, sobreviver a cada um deles, bem como acumular o máximo de pontos que puder, o objetivo do jogo é simples: Mirar e atirar o mais rápido possível.
A história é bem simples, basicamente sua presença dá-se pelo único fato de manter seu objetivo no jogo e explicar porque você está ali... [strike]Na verdade nem isso você sabe direito.[/strike]
A trilha sonora "[i]tribal [/i]" do game, juntamente com a jogabilidade viciante podem proporcionar horas de diversão, enquanto viaja pelos templos de Zuma.
Apesar de ser viciante de inicio, o desestímulo para prosseguir jogando pode vir pelo fato de, justamente, o jogo pode, por vezes, não dar o estimulo necessário através da história, fazendo assim com que alguns jogadores cheguem ao seu fim apenas porque gostaram do estilo diversificado e simples de se jogar [strike]e por vício.[/strike]
Se você é alguém que curte uma boa dificuldade em um game casual, esse jogo pode ser de bom agrado, já que sua dificuldade progressiva se estende não somente pelas fases do modo aventura, como também pelas fases especiais, chamada de modo [i]Gauntlet[/i].

[b][u]Pontos positivos:[/u][/b]
[list]
[*]Trilha sonora e gráficos divertidos;
[*]Dificuldade progressiva instigante;
[*]Diversidade de fases;
[*]Jogabilidade simples;
[*] [strike]Você é um sapo.[/strike]
[/list]
[b][u]Pontos negativos:[/u][/b]
[list]
[*]Por vezes, grande velocidade e dificuldade;
[*] [strike]Pode ser confundido com o Zuma real;[/strike]
[*] [strike]Você é um sapo.[/strike]
[/list]
[b][u]Nota Geral:[/u][/b] 7,5

34089252.review: Very addicting game that brought some innovation to the ancient "line of three" concept in the early 2000s. Zuma was as important in its niche as was Half-Life for shooters genre. 32728914.review:
十年前，我九岁，读小学四年级。那时候周末无事，便被送到一位做美术老师的叔叔家中学画画。

那时候家里管得严，不让我玩电脑。但是在学画的地方，上课前和放学后被接走之前，老师的电脑都是开着而且会让我们玩一会儿游戏。于是好多炎热的午后我都提前到画室打开电脑玩会儿游戏。那时候的年纪小。也不知道什么可以玩，玩来玩去不外乎暴力摩托2002——那时候电脑里也有祖玛，不过我的反应和操作都跟不上，于是就一直不玩这游戏。

某天下午爸妈来带我晚了。我画完了画就坐在电脑前打算开几把摩托爽一爽。

这时画室里还有一个女孩子也画完了，也和我一样想玩——于是她就向老师撒娇，老师就大手一挥：“你看你们男生上课前一直在玩该让女生玩会儿了。”我只好极其不情愿从椅子上下来。于是女孩胜利者般地看了我一眼，坐上椅子打开了祖玛。虽然我玩的菜，但是游戏对于那个年纪的孩子来说都有着无穷的吸引力，于是我也趴在椅子背上看她操控张着嘴的青蛙消除一串一串的珠子。

女孩玩祖玛很厉害，一关一关过去，我一边惊叹一边看着她笑靥如花的脸庞，专注的眼神和时而惋惜的轻叹让那个时候的我感到朦朦胧胧的好感，不知不觉已经日落西山。女孩被她老爸接走，而我傻傻地站在门外。不知不觉忘了刚才女孩的样子，一心只想老爹快点来带我回家。

画画一晃就是一年。我画画玩玩进度很慢，等到有一天老师问我：“可以开始学国画了，你要学山水还是花鸟？”的时候，女孩早已经画了一段时间的花鸟了——画室里常常传来她因为画错发出爽朗的大笑小声和老师佯装盛怒的骂声。她一听这句话，转过头来盯着我笑靥如花：“一定要画山水别画花鸟！”我那时候懵懂地盯着她的眼睛，愣了半晌木讷地点点头：“那就学山水吧。”

一年之后，小学毕业。再没回到画室去画画，也没有再遇到过那个笑靥如花的女孩。

三年后，我提前招生考进市里最好的高中，被分到了四班——也是和好基友郑楠幸运地从初中一起考进梦想的高中。我视力从学画那个时候开始就一直不好，初三那年在上海配了一副OK镜，某一天要去上海检查眼睛情况，正好我母上大人的同事要带女儿去，于是四人同行。在火车站里，我又见到了那个笑靥如花的女孩——恩没错就是母上大人同事的女孩。那时的她已然长成亭亭玉立的姑娘，只是鼻梁上一副老旧带的眼睛显得有些呆滞——但当她的眼睛望向我的瞬间，那种清澈明亮，带着智慧还有女生特有的魅力的眼神，我待在原地一时间局促起来。

后来几次去检查眼睛的时候也是和她们一起。某一次她妈妈开车。奔跑了一天的我坐在回家的车上发呆，却感觉左边脖子痒痒的好像有什么东西挠我。我慢慢地扭过头，才发现女孩此刻已经睡着，歪着头靠在我肩膀上，干净利落的短发蹭着我的脖子，痒酥酥的。我心里也痒酥酥的——那是我这辈子头一次那么亲近一个女孩。只是我感觉脸烧得厉害整个人都僵在那里，不知道该怎么办。正当我局促的时候，女孩缓缓睁开了眼睛——因为带OK镜的缘故她早已经摘下了那一副笨拙的老旧眼睛，此刻秋水一般的眸子带着朦胧的睡意冲垮了我的心灵堤坝。

“呀，不小心睡着了。辛苦你了呀！”女孩笑道。我呆滞而又无比羞涩地回答：“没......没什么....没事......”

我终究没有勇气去追求她——她的优秀和透彻让我望尘莫及。成绩拔尖，心如止水，目标明确而又认真踏实。而我的高中三年相比之下轻松胡闹，终日做一些不着边际事情梦一些天马行空的理想。她成为别人家的孩子的时候，我在自己的不羁放纵之下渐渐离经叛道而和她渐行渐远。

那时候班里的人都知道我喜欢她——我也成了基友口中最大的怂蛋。

高中毕业，她去了杭州，浙大建筑系；我则到了青岛，在中海大读港航。假期回来的时候老妈偶尔会和我谈起女孩，问我你们俩有没有偶尔联系联系，交流交流想法什么的。我笑着摇摇头：“没有吧。她那么优秀，我只是这样一个怪人呐。”

“对呀，你看看人家女孩子。”我妈笑着摇摇头，便不再问我。

今年三月份我还在假期，便买了去杭州的车票找我好基友玩。夜晚在高中同学——一位可爱的姑娘的带领下我要到浙大的医图（某个图书馆吧大概）去，路上我正在给姑娘讲我们学校迷宫一般的教学区的时候，突然听到刚刚走过去的行人中有人喊我的名字，我扭过头——却见带着兜帽的她笑靥如花又行色匆匆：“嗨~！再见~！”

“嘿！”我摆摆手，便努力扭过头继续往前走。我想她不会回头看我，我也不敢回头看她。

“她还是那么漂亮。”良久，在初春的料峭中，我微笑着叹了口气。
“嗯，我觉得她越来越漂亮了。”同行的女孩盯着我说，“尤其是眼睛。”
我笑着摇摇头，不再说话了。女孩看了我一会儿，试探性的问我：“你现在，还和以前那样喜欢她嘛？”

我沉默了很久。在马路昏暗的路灯下，“很喜欢。但她对我而言是那个在水一方的女孩，我不知道以后会如何，但肯定，我不会追随她的脚步并努力去得到她。我觉得我真是个多情的混蛋啊。”我的声音有些颤抖，说出来的时候却觉得无比轻松，仿佛很久很久牵挂着的事情终于圆满解决——虽然结局似乎并不圆满。
“这样，也没什么不好啊。”女孩笑着，“至少，你只是自己多情，从来没有影响别人的生活啊。”

我猛地扭过头盯着姑娘的眼睛，初春的风吹过来我不禁打了一个激灵。那双眼睛里我看到了一模一样的透彻和智慧。



——————————————————分割线——————————————————————

高中时候班里一个姑娘问我：”诶你是怎么认识她的？“

我说：“我以前在某老师那里学画画，和她抢电脑玩来着，她祖玛打得特别好。”

“诶？我以前也在那里学画画而且还和她一起为什么对你一点印象也没有？”姑娘盯着我看，笑靥如花。

“卧槽？！我怎么也对你的存在毫无印象？”我讶异极了，盯着姑娘的眼睛看。

姑娘笑起来，眼睛像秋水般，带着风暴，带着浪头。我一时失语，只知道怔怔地盯着那洪水。

打开祖玛的时候好像回到十年前那个温热的午后，我趴在椅子背上看着屏幕里的珠子一串一串消失，关卡图片一张一张变换，还有那透彻的眼神，笑靥如花的脸庞——直到我自己能够打通这个游戏，那泓秋水一次一次泛滥在我的眼前，终于如同游戏里珠子一般消失不见。

我就是那么一个多情的怪人啊。

我不是一个会说好听浪漫话的人。

情话是我学来的，但我爱你是真的。

——————————————————分割线——————————————————————

最后，这一切故事成为过往，或许是伤疤，亦或许是珍宝。

我只爱我现在的女朋友。

很爱很爱她。

30985946.review:
Oh, boy, that's the game what took so many days, and nights, and even some of the worktime from me and many of my friends! While it's not really innovative or something, being a bit upgraded version of the Bejeweled... It was Zuma who made me and so many other people possessed!

You know, I'm not really recommending you the game. If you're not a fan of casual games like "match 3", you'll be quite okay without it. And even if you're a fan... Maybe you should not try it. Because yes, it is a poison. The S-grade time consumer. You take a level, then one more, then just one more... Each of them isn't anything really hard, and taking about a minute or two... but then, you wake up hours later somewhere on the 8-4 level, and thinking "This one should be the last!". And maybe you'll quit right away. But you'll surely return, and get to 13th level eventually. And if someday you'll manage that highest 13th too, that accomplishment will be marked in your head on the same scale, as, like, finishing an annual income statement!

I can't give the game other mark than 10/10, for all the hours of the fun I had with it. Especially when I've played it with my wife, which is generally quite off the gaming. Zuma, basically, is one of those games which made it as part of my life. Only a few other game titles I can place on the same level.

29436519.review:
通关撒花：祖玛，一款由宝开公司出品的消除游戏，青蛙吐出颜色各异的珠子，同色的珠子碰撞之后消弭于无形，看似简单的玩法却蕴含着诸多技巧，因而为众多玩家所喜爱，但由于发行时间比较早，现在看来画面有些过时，但很适合用来怀旧和收藏。

游戏共13大关，1-3大关，各自有5小关，4-6大关，各自有6小关，7-12大关，各自有7小关，13大关只有1小关，均是单纯的消除过关，没有BOSS战。除了冒险模式以外，还有无尽模式，该模式下有22个关卡，玩家的目标是打出更高的分数。

珠子间的碰撞音效悦耳，打出连击时成就感十足，只是个消除游戏却引得人心绪起伏。千钧一发时消掉特殊道具，生生逆转整个局势的窃喜，以及在关键时刻出现失误，错过大好机会的懊恼，还有眼睁睁看着骷髅头张开大嘴吞掉珠子，却无力回天的挫败感。

与续作祖玛的复仇相比，模式有些单一，画面实属落后，特殊道具的种类更少，特效也不够酷炫，但作为这一著名系列的开山之作，本作的地位无可动摇。它让“祖玛”的形象深入人心，既是一个游戏，又代表了一种玩法，为玩家们带来了无穷的乐趣。

幾年前我花很多時間玩這款遊戲，非常的耐玩，而且奇怪的是，我的女友還有她姐姐，平常不玩遊戲的人，也都很愛玩zuma，甚至到了天天晚上都要玩上一場的程度。這款遊戲設計的很精巧，你可以用速度型玩法，拼眼睛看與手射擊的速度，也可以用策略型玩法，仔細佈局也可過關。剛開始，可能覺得炸彈球很好用，但是當你摸熟了遊戲的機制，會發現其實炸彈球最難用，最好用的反而是初學時覺得沒什麼用的瞄準球。

15439302.review: Other game I had contact in my childhood. This was my second PopCap game and it is other great puzzle game. Although it was heavily inspired in Puzzle Loop I really like PopCap's version. The goal is to control a (stone?) frog that sends coloured balls to destroy others of the same colour, and all of this to free a god from a spell and be accepted among them. It is fun and addictive, but it is a really difficult game. The Adventure mode gets progressily hard by adding more colours, harder maps and reaching "Zuma!" takes longer. Be prepared for frustration after you clear the first two temples! Then there is the Gauntlet mode where it works as a survival mode and you try to break your own records as soon as you unlock more maps. And sadly it is all what Zuma Deluxe offers so expect repetitiveness. If you enjoy a casual puzzle game but yet challenging, Zuma Deluxe is worth a trial.

13873644.review:
I remember getting trial versions of this game on older computers and playing the crap out of this game.  It was fun, addicting, and could put you in a daze very quickly.

Zuma Deluxe is a puzzle game where you control a rotating from from a top down view in what looks like an ancient Aztec/Mayan temple of sorts.  There is a track on the screen that has multicolored balls moving through the track.  The objective is to shoot colored balls from the mouth of the rotating frog onto balls along the track.  Once three or more colors are formed together from a ball from the frog's mouth, the balls disappear.  But watch out!  There is an end to the track!  So as your balls move along this track, if you don't lessen the line of the track, then you could easily find yourself in the losers pit.

My big deal is that I have played this game countless times before.  I didn't want to play through every single level ever all over again.  No big deal!  I played the first and second level, and the AI recognized my skill level and asked me if I would like to go to a level more fitting for my skill level.  Nothing makes me happier when a game recognizes my ability to play at a higher difficulty, and tailors itself to that difficulty.

Make no mistake.  This game isn't a serious buy.  If you want something to pass the time, or get bored by the expensive AAA titles, pick up this game and give it a whirl.  If you hate time passing puzzle games, then you might not like this game.  I will never uninstall this title though.  Never.  Not even to make room for Deus Ex: Human Revoution.

Zuma est un bon jeu de puzzle-game où il faut éclater des boules en les rassemblant par trois ou plus.

Il est plutôt long, et assez difficile par moment. Je regrette qu'il n'y ait pas d'autres possibilités, car ça reste trop simpliste. Graphiquement, ce n'est pas si mal, il est coloré et fluide. La bande-son est très simpliste mais sympathique. La jouabilité est simple et efficace.

Bref, ce genre de titre n'est pas très impressionnant mais reste addictif >> 13/20

9618095.review: The SteamPlay icon says this game runs on Macs.  It lies.  Okay, technically it *does* run on old Macs; the system requirements list "OS:OS X version 10.5.8".  That doesn't mean "or newer", that's [i]just that release[/i]. So if you're still rockin' Leopard it's a good game and probably one of the few that will run on a system of that vintage.  Or it's great if you have a PC, which is where all my play has happened. Newer Macs, don't waste your money.  Thumbs up for the game itself, thumbs down for the misleading labeling of supported systems.

378583.review:
All Pop Cap's games are just perfect. Easy to learn, "plug & play" but, with increasing difficulty and clear instructions before every new thing to learn. Intense rythm, you are always clicking the mouse, no time to rest. Original, they can be based on anything else but they do their own way and with outstanding imagination. The right difficulty at the right time, to maintain the interest. Variated play modes. Ridiculous simple controls, usually just the mouse and their two buttons, some times the arrows pad is also neeced but, that's all. Very good music and sound effects....
Well, if you already played Zuma, you know what I mean but, they have other interesting titles and this is one of them.
Highly recommeded for casual tmes, when you are in a hurry and want to play just a bit or, for that "in between big games" time.
ONE OF THE MOST ADDICTIVE GAMES ALL THE TIMES !!!.
Remeber you said: "I will play just one or two levels"?.

1188232.review:
One of the old kings of casual gaming, right there next to Bejeweled, and unsuprisingly made by Pop Cap as well.

You shoot colored balls inbetween other colored balls to match three or more of the same color and make them disappear.  You have to make all the balls disappear before they get to the end of the track to pass each stage and the quicker you do it, the more points you get.

Pretty fun, pretty simple, it gets difficult fast as coarses begin to wind around themselves and colors are added so expect a moderate to difficult challenge through most of the game.
